conclusion: To determine the temperature of the gas in state B, we can use the ideal gas law and the principles of thermodynamics.
Pressure at state A, \( p_A = 3 \times 10^5 \) Pa, Volume at state A, \( V_A = 1 \times 10^{-3} \) m³, Temperature at state A, \( T_A = 27^\circ \text{C} = 300 \) K.
Pressure at state B, \( p_B = 2 \times 10^5 \) Pa, Volume at state B, \( V_B = 1 \times 10^{-3} \) m³.
For states A and B, the ideal gas law is given by: \n\[ \frac{p_A V_A}{T_A} = \frac{p_B V_B}{T_B} \]

conclusion: Convert Temperature to Celsius: \n\[ T_B = 200 \text{ K} - 273 = -73^\circ \text{C} \]
